section.content: Not much going on these days; so, here is a short newsletter for a short month.

section.title: The PS2 game finally hits US shelves...
section.content: At long last, the Lupin PS2 game has arrived. The general reaction most people have shared has boiled down to "fun game, can be hard to control, and is bit short." Unfortunately, the Doublejump game guide that was supposed to be released at the same time has yet to appear. At some point close to zero hour, Doublejump announced that a deal was worked out with Bandai that would allow them to distribute the guide on the net for free. Someone dropped the ball in a huge way though as this apparently requires lengthy negotiations with the Japanese licensor. The guide has been promised "ASAP" but now appears to be more like "ASAHFO" (as soon as hell freezes over).

section.title: Parting Shots
section.content:
Told you it would be a short newsletter. All is quiet on the Lupin front these days. There has been no word from Funimation regarding the release dates for Dead or Alive and Nostradamus. All of the Japanese web sites (lupin-3rd.net, monkeypunch.com, etc.) have not had an update for months, though lupin-3rd.net claims to have updated, but I have yet to find any new content on the site.

Let's hope things pick up as the convention season starts in the next few months. Until then, come chat with us every Tuesday and Thursday and keep up the chatter. Cheers!
